title: Hungarian Beef Goulash
instructions:
1. In a 3 1/2, 4 or 5 quart crockery cooker, place potatoes, onions and garlic.
  2. Add beef. In a bowl combine broth, undrained tomatoes, tomato paste, paprika, caraway or fennel seed and salt. Pour over all. cover; cook on low heat setting for 10-12 hours or on high heat setting for 5-6 hours. Stir thawed artichoke hearts into cooker. Cover and let stand for 10 minutes. Serve over hot cooked noodles. Top each serving with a spoonful of sour cream.
  3. Makes 6 servings.

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 ounce x 9 package frozen artichoke hearts thawed
extendedIngredients.name: artichoke hearts

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 pounds beef stew meat cut into 1 inch cubes
extendedIngredients.name: beef stew meat

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 ounce x 14 can chunky tomatoes with garlic and 1 ounce x 6 can tomato paste
extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon caraway seed or fennel seed
extendedIngredients.name: fennel seed

extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 mediums potatoes cut into 1 inch cubes
extendedIngredients.name: potatoes

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1In a 3 1/2, 4 or 5 quart crockery cooker, place potatoes, onions and garlic.
extendedIngredients.name: in a 3 1/2
